section.name: WOProject Tasks Installation
section.p: There is no WOProject installation per se. All WOProject needs is the following JAR files included in the distribution:
These files can be copied anywhere in the filesystem. Of course Ant has to be installed. It can be downloaded from http://ant.apache.org/.

section.name: Ant Tasks
section.p: WOProject ships with the following Ant tasks:

ul.li: WOCompile: A Javac task extension that allows including WOFrameworks in CLASSPATH.
WOApplication: A task for assembling WebObjects applications.
WOFramework: A task for assembling WebObjects frameworks.
WOGen: A task for generating custom Java EO classes from EOModel.
EOModel: A task for configuring custom connection dictionary for EOModels.
PBIndex: Maintains PB.project file for integration with WOBuilder on Windows.
PBXIndex: Maintains PBX.pbproj file for integration with WOBuilder and EOModeler on older Mac OS X.
XcodeIndex: Maintains XCode project files for integration with WOBuilder on the latest Mac OS X.
FrameworkSet: An extension of Ant FileSet to match WOFrameworks.

section.name: Localization Issues
section.p: WOApplication and WOFramework tasks are dealing with resources (for instance WOComponents, images, etc.). Resources of the applications that have a multilingual audience require localization. For the discussion of how localized resources are handled by WOProject, follow this link.
